quadrillion

Class QGrid

  • java.lang.Object
    • quadrillion.QGrid

  • public class QGrid
extends java.lang.Object
    Defines a Grid class, which implicitly has a bounding box of (0,0) to (3,-3), i.e. composed of a 4x4 QCoordinate grid whose top left corner is situated at (0,0), and bottom right corner is situated at (3,-3). Only the blocking tiles are explicitly stored. Has two faces.
    Version:
    20190316
    Author:
    Unsal Ozturk

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      QGrid(java.util.List<QCoordinate> blockersFront, java.util.List<QCoordinate> blockersBack, QGridType type)
      Constructs a grid given the blocking tiles on each face.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void flip()
      Flips the face of the grid to the other side.
      java.util.List<QCoordinate> getBlockers()
      Returns the coordinates of the blocking tiles of the active face of the grid.
      boolean getCurrentFace()
      Returns the current face of the grid.
      QGridType getGridType()
      Returns the grid type of the grid, one among four grids as present in the original game.
      void rotate90(boolean direction)
      Rotates the grid 90 degrees clockwise or counter-clockwise.

    • Constructor Detail

      • QGrid

        public QGrid(java.util.List<QCoordinate> blockersFront,
             java.util.List<QCoordinate> blockersBack,
             QGridType type)
        Constructs a grid given the blocking tiles on each face.
        Parameters:
        blockersFront - List of blocking tiles on one face of the grid.
        blockersBack - List of blocking tiles on the other face of the grid.
        type - The grid type of the grid, one among four grids as present in the original game.

    • Method Detail

      • flip

        public void flip()
        Flips the face of the grid to the other side.

      • rotate90

        public void rotate90(boolean direction)
        Rotates the grid 90 degrees clockwise or counter-clockwise.
        Parameters:
        direction - The direction of the rotation. True indicates a counter-clockwise 90 degree rotation, and false indicates a 90 degree clockwise rotation.

      • getBlockers

        public java.util.List<QCoordinate> getBlockers()
        Returns the coordinates of the blocking tiles of the active face of the grid.
        Returns:
        The list of coordinates of the blocking tiles.

      • getCurrentFace

        public boolean getCurrentFace()
        Returns the current face of the grid. Note that the grid has two faces.
        Returns:
        True for one face, false for the other.

      • getGridType

        public QGridType getGridType()
        Returns the grid type of the grid, one among four grids as present in the original game.
        Returns:
        The grid type.
